title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) – On a night where offense was a premium and the final score resembled a bygone era, Hakeem Olajuwon authored a timeless masterpiece. The Houston Rockets’ legendary center delivered a performance for the ages, carrying his team to a gritty 89-80 victory over the Sacramento Kings.

In a game where no other player on either side cracked 20 points, Olajuwon was a monument of dominance, pouring in a staggering 43 points. He was an unstoppable force in the paint, turning the low post into his personal showcase against a Kings defense that had no answer. While Mitch Richmond managed 19 for Sacramento, his efforts were a flicker against Olajuwon’s inferno.

The Rockets, leaning heavily on their superstar, saw only Clyde Drexler (17 points) join him in double figures. The game was a defensive slog, but every time Houston needed a basket to quell a Sacramento run, the ball found its way into Olajuwon’s hands. His footwork was a ballet, his touch around the rim unerring, and his will undeniable.

This was not a night for flashy transition play or a three-point barrage. This was a testament to one man’s singular greatness, a throwback performance that underscored Olajuwon’s place among the game’s true giants. On a night the scoreboard barely cracked 80, "The Dream" soared above all, delivering 43 points of pure, historic reality and single-handedly willing the Rockets to victory.
